title: Chef De Piece, "Nina, ou la folle par amour", ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave
inscribed: Stamp reading 'FRANCOIS GORGERAT NANTES BON TEINT'enclosed in box. Also 'IDF' and 'IDVF' and some undecipherable smudges.
provenance: formerly in the collection of Elinor merrell where it was No. 28 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions: Warp: 82.5 cm (32 1/2 in.). Weft: 155 cm (61 1/4 in.) Piece is made up of three fragments sewn together.
description: Design in red on a white ground. Isolated scenes that illustrate the story of "Nina", a musical comedy by Dalayrac (1753–1809) in Paris in 1786. The book was by Marsollier (1750–1817).

tombstone.epitaph:
Chef De Piece, "Nina, ou la folle par amour", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-9.
